title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
message:
Hi.


I have an 820-3476 board with no backlight. The board had already been worked (when I say worked I mean attacked with a hot poker). After a bit of digging and a lot of F*ing about clearing up everything that had already been done I found what the last guy had missed... I think.

R7731 and R7732 on the feedback voltage divider to U7700 both measured 12.51k parallel resistance because of a short to ground on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT on the LVDS connector. After 4 hours, it was a short on the LVDS!

Are the MacBook Pro retina and MacBook Air 2011+ LCD connectors the same? They do at least look and fit the same.

There is also no enable signal EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN coming from the PCH.
Any info on this would be great please

title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
message: Connectors are the same. Before fixing the backlight do you even have an image on the LCD? If the connector was shorted there is a good chance the LCD cable will be burned too.

title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
message: Diode mode measurement on pin 3 and 4 of LCD connector with and without LCD plugged in?

title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
message:
EDIT: Tested pins 3 - 4 in diode mode both with and without cable 0.75v.
Replaced connector, plugged screen, image there but fuse blown.
